intro: Bobua pergracilis, commonly known as the slender bobua, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Bobua pergracilis is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
